dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, this article, it's really getting at, uh, how neoliberalism, this whole unfettered markets thing, it's just, it’s crumbling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, this article, it's really getting at, uh, how neoliberalism, this whole unfettered markets thing, it's just, it's crumbling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The credibility of neoliberalisms faith in unfettered markets as the surest road to shared prosperity is on life-support these days. And well it should be. The simultaneous waning of confidence in neoliberalism and in democracy is no coincidence or mere correlation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Crumbling? Please. It’s always crumbling, isn’t it? Like, every other day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Crumbling? Please. It's always crumbling, isn't it? Like, every other day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but the authors here, they connect it to like, a deep erosion of democratic principles. You know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but the authors here, they connect it to like, a deep erosion of democratic principles. You know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Neoliberalism has undermined democracy for 40 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Democratic principles? You mean, um, politicians just doing whatever they want? What's new?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Democratic principles? You mean, um, politicians just doing whatever they want? What's new?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they talk about how countries were essentially, like, blackmailed by financial institutions, right? If a leader spoke up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they talk about how countries were essentially, like, blackmailed by financial institutions, right? If a leader spoke up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If a leading presidential candidate in an emerging market lost favor with Wall Street, the banks would pull their money out of the country. Voters then faced a stark choice: Give in to Wall Street or face a severe financial crisis. It was as if Wall Street had more political power than the countrys citizens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Blackmailed. Uh-huh. Or just, you know, making smart financial decisions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Blackmailed. Uh-huh. Or just, you know, making smart financial decisions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the article says it was about voters being forced to choose between Wall Street and, like, total meltdown.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the article says it was about voters being forced to choose between Wall Street and, like, total meltdown.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Voters then faced a stark choice: Give in to Wall Street or face a severe financial crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that’s, that’s a tough choice, I guess. Or maybe it’s just the market working.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's, that's a tough choice, I guess. Or maybe it's just the market working.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And this idea that benefits would "trickle down"? It just, it didn't happen, did it? Wealth just, uh, piled up at the top.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this idea that benefits would trickle down? It just, it didn't happen, did it? Wealth just, uh, piled up at the top.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As wages stagnated and the stock market soared, income and wealth flowed up, rather than trickling down.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Trickle down." Oh, that old chestnut. Still waiting for my trickle, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Trickle down. Oh, that old chestnut. Still waiting for my trickle, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It led to this massive mistrust, a deep betrayal, Host_A, because people felt deceived.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It led to this massive mistrust, a deep betrayal, Host_A, because people felt deceived.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ordinary citizens felt like they had been sold a bill of goods. They were right to feel conned. We are now experiencing the political consequences of this grand deception: distrust of the elites, of the economic science on which neoliberalism was based, and of the money-corrupted political system that made it all possible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Deceived. Or just, like, didn't understand, maybe? It's complicated stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Deceived. Or just, like, didn't understand, maybe? It's complicated stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But even the 2008 crisis, the climate crisis, they were, um, direct results.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But even the two thousand eight crisis, the climate crisis, they were, um, direct results.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the 2008 financial crisis failed to make us realize that unfettered markets dont work, the climate crisis certainly should: neoliberalism will literally bring an end to our civilization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Everything's a direct result of everything these days. Come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Everything's a direct result of everything these days. Come on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The article says we need a rebirth of the Enlightenment, you know, liberty, knowledge...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The article says we need a rebirth of the Enlightenment, you know, liberty, knowledge...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The only way forward, the only way to save our planet and our civilization, is a rebirth of history. We must revitalize the Enlightenment and recommit to honoring its values of freedom, respect for knowledge, and democracy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A rebirth. Sure. Just, uh, snap our fingers and fix it all. Right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A rebirth. Sure. Just, uh, snap our fingers and fix it all. Right.
